TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit ThreadPool extends System.Object
public ref class ThreadPool abstract sealed

summary.span: 提供執行緒的集區，可用來執行工作、張貼工作項目、處理非同步 I/O、代表其他執行緒等候，以及處理計時器。

span.span: Provides a pool of threads that can be used to execute tasks, post work items, process asynchronous I/O, wait on behalf of other threads, and process timers.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 許多應用程式建立花太多的時間處於睡眠狀態，等候事件發生的執行緒。Many applications create threads that spend a great deal of time in the sleeping state, waiting for an event to occur. 其他執行緒可能會進入休眠狀態後才能定期喚醒來輪詢有變更或更新的狀態資訊。Other threads might enter a sleeping state only to be awakened periodically to poll for a change or update status information. 執行緒集區可讓您更有效率地使用藉由提供您的應用程式的系統所管理的背景工作執行緒集區的執行緒。The thread pool enables you to use threads more efficiently by providing your application with a pool of worker threads that are managed by the system. 使用執行緒集區作業的範例包括下列各項：Examples of operations that use thread pool threads include the following: - 當您建立或以非同步方式執行一些工作，根據預設，執行緒集區執行緒上執行排程工作的物件。When you create a or object to perform some task asynchronously, by default the task is scheduled to run on a thread pool thread. - 非同步的計時器會使用執行緒集區。Asynchronous timers use the thread pool. 執行緒集區執行緒執行回呼類別，並引發事件類別。Thread pool threads execute callbacks from the class and raise events from the class. - 當您使用已註冊的等候控制代碼時，則系統執行緒會監視在等候控制代碼的狀態。When you use registered wait handles, a system thread monitors the status of the wait handles. 等候作業完成時，執行緒集區的背景工作執行緒會執行對應的回呼函式。When a wait operation completes, a worker thread from the thread pool executes the corresponding callback function. - 當您呼叫排入佇列的方法，以便在執行緒集區執行緒上執行的方法。When you call the method to queue a method for execution on a thread pool thread. 您可以傳遞給方法委派。You do this by passing the method a delegate. 委派的簽章The delegate has the signature ```csharp void WaitCallback(Object state) ``` ```vb Sub WaitCallback(state As Object) ``` 其中`state`是物件，包含由委派所要使用的資料。where `state` is an object that contains data to be used by the delegate. 實際的資料可以傳遞至委派，藉由呼叫方法。The actual data can be passed to the delegate by calling the method. > [!NOTE] > Managed 的執行緒集區中的執行緒為背景執行緒。The threads in the managed thread pool are background threads. 也就是他們屬性是`true`。That is, their properties are `true`. 這表示執行緒不會持續執行的所有前景執行緒都結束後的應用程式。This means that a thread will not keep an application running after all foreground threads have exited. > [!IMPORTANT] > 當執行緒集區會重複使用的執行緒時，它不會清除執行緒區域儲存區中，或標示的欄位中的資料屬性。When the thread pool reuses a thread, it does not clear the data in thread local storage or in fields that are marked with the attribute. 因此，當方法會檢查執行緒區域儲存區，或欄位，會標示屬性，它找到的值可能剩餘的執行緒集區執行緒的先前版本會使用。Therefore, when a method examines thread local storage or fields that are marked with the attribute, the values it finds might be left over from an earlier use of the thread pool thread. 您也可以將佇列的執行緒集區以等候作業無關的工作項目。You can also queue work items that are not related to a wait operation to the thread pool. 若要要求工作項目由執行緒集區中的執行緒，呼叫方法。To request that a work item be handled by a thread in the thread pool, call the method. 此方法會採用做為參數的方法或將會從執行緒集區中選取的執行緒所呼叫的委派的參考。This method takes as a parameter a reference to the method or delegate that will be called by the thread selected from the thread pool. 沒有任何方法可取消的工作項目之後已加入佇列。There is no way to cancel a work item after it has been queued. 計時器佇列中的計時器和已註冊之等候作業也會使用執行緒集區。Timer-queue timers and registered wait operations also use the thread pool. 它們的回呼函式會排入執行緒集區。Their callback functions are queued to the thread pool. 沒有每個處理序的一個執行緒集區。There is one thread pool per process. 從 [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)] 開始，處理序的執行緒集區預設大小取決於數個因素，例如虛擬位址空間的大小。Beginning with the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)], the default size of the thread pool for a process depends on several factors, such as the size of the virtual address space. 處理序可以呼叫 方法來決定執行緒數目。A process can call the method to determine the number of threads. 可以使用變更的執行緒集區中的執行緒數目方法。The number of threads in the thread pool can be changed by using the method. 每個執行緒會使用預設堆疊大小，並在預設的優先權執行。Each thread uses the default stack size and runs at the default priority. > [!NOTE] > 裝載.NET Framework 的 unmanaged 程式碼可以使用變更的執行緒集區大小`CorSetMaxThreads`函式，定義於 mscoree.h 檔案。Unmanaged code that hosts the .NET Framework can change the size of the thread pool by using the `CorSetMaxThreads` function, defined in the mscoree.h file. 執行緒集區視需要提供新的背景工作執行緒或 I/O 完成執行緒，直到它到達每個類別目錄的最小值。The thread pool provides new worker threads or I/O completion threads on demand until it reaches the minimum for each category. 當到達最小值時，執行緒集區可以建立額外的執行緒，該類別中，或等到部分工作完成。When a minimum is reached, the thread pool can create additional threads in that category or wait until some tasks complete. 從 [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)] 開始，執行緒集區會建立並終結背景工作執行緒，以便最佳化輸送量，輸送量的定義為每個時間單位完成的工作數目。Beginning with the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)], the thread pool creates and destroys worker threads in order to optimize throughput, which is defined as the number of tasks that complete per unit of time. 執行緒太少可能無法最有效地利用可用資源，而執行緒太多則可能增加資源爭用的情況。Too few threads might not make optimal use of available resources, whereas too many threads could increase resource contention. > [!NOTE] > 當需求很低時，執行緒集區執行緒的實際數目可能低於最小值。When demand is low, the actual number of thread pool threads can fall below the minimum values. 您可以使用 方法取得這些最小值。You can use the method to obtain these minimum values. > [!CAUTION] > 您可以使用方法，以增加最低的執行緒數目。You can use the method to increase the minimum number of threads. 不過，不必要地增加這些值，可能會造成效能問題。However, unnecessarily increasing these values can cause performance problems. 如果太多工作同時啟動，則所有工作可能都會變慢。If too many tasks start at the same time, all of them might appear to be slow. 在大部分情況下，執行緒集區使用自己的演算法來配置執行緒的效能較佳。In most cases the thread pool will perform better with its own algorithm for allocating threads. ## Examples 在下列範例中，主應用程式執行緒方法排入佇列名為`ThreadProc`執行緒集區執行緒，而會休眠一秒，，然後結束上執行。In the following example, the main application thread queues a method named `ThreadProc` to execute on a thread pool thread, sleeps for one second, and then exits. `ThreadProc`方法只會顯示一則訊息。The `ThreadProc` method simply displays a message. [!code-cpp[System.Threading.ThreadPool QueueUserWorkItem0#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.ThreadPool QueueUserWorkItem0/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Threading.ThreadPool QueueUserWorkItem0#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.ThreadPool QueueUserWorkItem0/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.ThreadPool QueueUserWorkItem0#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.ThreadPool QueueUserWorkItem0/VB/source.vb#1)] 如果您註解的呼叫方法中，主執行緒結束的執行緒集區執行緒上的方法執行之前。If you comment out the call to the method, the main thread exits before method runs on the thread pool thread. 執行緒集區會使用背景執行緒，不讓應用程式順利執行中的所有前景執行緒已經都終止。The thread pool uses background threads, which do not keep the application running if all foreground threads have terminated. （這是簡單的範例，競爭條件）。(This is a simple example of a race condition.)

remarks.format: ## Remarks 當會傳回指定的變數`workerThreads`含有額外的背景工作執行緒可以啟動，且指定的變數`completionPortThreads`包含其他可能的非同步 I/O 執行緒的數目已啟動。When returns, the variable specified by `workerThreads` contains the number of additional worker threads that can be started, and the variable specified by `completionPortThreads` contains the number of additional asynchronous I/O threads that can be started. 如果沒有可用的執行緒，額外的執行緒集區要求保留已排入佇列直到執行緒集區執行緒變成可用。If there are no available threads, additional thread pool requests remain queued until thread pool threads become available. ## Examples 簡單的應用程式啟動時，下列範例會顯示背景工作執行緒和可用的 I/O 執行緒的數目。The following example displays the number of worker threads and I/O threads available when a simple app is started. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.ThreadPool.GetAvailableThreads#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.ThreadPool.GetAvailableThreads/CS/Example2.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.ThreadPool.GetAvailableThreads#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.ThreadPool.GetAvailableThreads/VB/Example2.vb#2)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 當會傳回指定的變數`workerThreads`包含允許執行緒集區中的背景工作執行緒和變數所指定的最大數目`completionPortThreads`包含中允許的非同步 I/O 執行緒最大數目執行緒集區。When returns, the variable specified by `workerThreads` contains the maximum number of worker threads allowed in the thread pool, and the variable specified by `completionPortThreads` contains the maximum number of asynchronous I/O threads allowed in the thread pool. 您可以使用方法，以判斷在任何指定時間的實際的執行緒集區中的執行緒數目。You can use the method to determine the actual number of threads in the thread pool at any given time. 您可以使用設定執行緒集區中的背景工作執行緒和非同步 I/O 執行緒的最大數目。You can use the to set the maximum number of worker threads and asynchronous I/O threads in the thread pool. 您可以在無數個執行緒集區的要求，因為系統記憶體可讓佇列。You can queue as many thread pool requests as system memory allows. 如果有更多的要求，超過的執行緒集區，其他要求會繼續已排入佇列，直到執行緒集區執行緒變成可用為止。If there are more requests than thread pool threads, the additional requests remain queued until thread pool threads become available. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範如何擷取最大和可用的執行緒集區中的執行緒數目的計數。The following code example shows how to retrieve a count of the maximum and available number of threads in the thread pool. 工作項目會排入佇列，會使用`FileStream`以非同步方式寫入兩個檔案。A work item is queued that uses `FileStream` to asynchronously write to two files. 回呼方法的計時重疊。The callback methods are timed to overlap. 背景工作執行緒處理的工作項目，並根據速度和電腦上的處理器數目，一或兩個完成連接埠執行緒處理 「 寫入 」 操作。A worker thread handles the work item and, depending on the speed and number of processors on the computer, one or two completion port threads handle the write operations. [!code-cpp[System.Threading.ThreadPool.GetAvailableThreads#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.ThreadPool.GetAvailableThreads/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Threading.ThreadPool.GetAvailableThreads#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.ThreadPool.GetAvailableThreads/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.ThreadPool.GetAvailableThreads#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.ThreadPool.GetAvailableThreads/VB/source.vb#1)]

span.span: Retrieves the minimum number of threads the thread pool creates on demand, as new requests are made, before switching to an algorithm for managing thread creation and destruction.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 執行緒集區視需要提供新的背景工作執行緒或 I/O 完成執行緒，直到它到達每個類別目錄的最小值。The thread pool provides new worker threads or I/O completion threads on demand until it reaches the minimum for each category. 根據預設，執行緒的數目下限設為在系統上的處理器數目。By default, the minimum number of threads is set to the number of processors on a system. 當到達最小值時，執行緒集區可以建立額外的執行緒，該類別中，或等到部分工作完成。When the minimum is reached, the thread pool can create additional threads in that category or wait until some tasks complete. 開頭為[!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]，執行緒集區建立和終結執行緒，以便最佳化輸送量，而定義為每個時間單位完成的工作數目。Beginning with the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)], the thread pool creates and destroys threads in order to optimize throughput, which is defined as the number of tasks that complete per unit of time. 執行緒太少可能無法最有效地利用可用資源，而執行緒太多則可能增加資源爭用的情況。Too few threads might not make optimal use of available resources, whereas too many threads could increase resource contention. > [!NOTE] > 當需求很低時，執行緒集區執行緒的實際數目可能低於最小值。When demand is low, the actual number of thread pool threads can fall below the minimum values. ## Examples 下列範例會設定背景工作執行緒的數目下限為 4，並保留原始值的非同步 I/O 完成執行緒的數目下限。The following example sets the minimum number of worker threads to four, and preserves the original value for the minimum number of asynchronous I/O completion threads. [!code-cpp[System.Threading.ThreadPool.GetSetMinThreads#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.ThreadPool.GetSetMinThreads/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Threading.ThreadPool.GetSetMinThreads#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.ThreadPool.GetSetMinThreads/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.ThreadPool.GetSetMinThreads#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.ThreadPool.GetSetMinThreads/VB/source.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 您可以將已排入佇列的方法，在方法定義，或您可以使用此類別的執行個體欄位中所需的資料多載會接受物件，其中包含必要的資料。You can place data required by the queued method in the instance fields of the class in which the method is defined, or you can use the overload that accepts an object containing the necessary data. > [!NOTE] > Visual Basic 使用者可以省略建構函式，並只使用`AddressOf`運算子傳遞至回呼方法時。Visual Basic users can omit the constructor, and simply use the `AddressOf` operator when passing the callback method to . Visual Basic 會自動呼叫正確的委派建構函式。Visual Basic automatically calls the correct delegate constructor. ## 版本資訊Version Information 在.NET Framework 2.0 版中，屬性值會傳播至背景工作執行緒已排入佇列使用方法。In the .NET Framework version 2.0, the property value is propagated to worker threads queued using the method. 在舊版中，主體的資訊不會傳播。In earlier versions, the principal information is not propagated. ## Examples 下列範例會使用方法多載來工作排入佇列，這由`ThreadProc`方法，讓執行緒變成可用時執行。The following example uses the method overload to queue a task, which is represented by the `ThreadProc` method, to execute when a thread becomes available. 沒有工作資訊會提供使用這個多載。No task information is supplied with this overload. 因此，若要使用的資訊`ThreadProc`方法僅限於方法所屬的物件。Therefore, the information that is available to the `ThreadProc` method is limited to the object the method belongs to. [!code-cpp[System.Threading.ThreadPool QueueUserWorkItem0#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.ThreadPool QueueUserWorkItem0/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Threading.ThreadPool QueueUserWorkItem0#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.ThreadPool QueueUserWorkItem0/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.ThreadPool QueueUserWorkItem0#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.ThreadPool QueueUserWorkItem0/VB/source.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果回呼方法需要複雜的資料，您可以定義包含資料的類別。If the callback method requires complex data, you can define a class to contain the data. > [!NOTE] > Visual Basic 使用者可以省略建構函式，並只使用`AddressOf`運算子傳遞至回呼方法時。Visual Basic users can omit the constructor, and simply use the `AddressOf` operator when passing the callback method to . Visual Basic 會自動呼叫正確的委派建構函式。Visual Basic automatically calls the correct delegate constructor. ## 版本資訊Version Information 在.NET Framework 2.0 版中，屬性值會傳播至背景工作執行緒已排入佇列使用方法。In the .NET Framework version 2.0, the property value is propagated to worker threads queued using the method. 在舊版中，主體的資訊不會傳播。In earlier versions, the principal information is not propagated. ## Examples 下列範例會使用.NET 執行緒集區來計算`Fibonacci`五個數字，介於 20 到 40 之間的結果。The following example uses the .NET thread pool to calculate the `Fibonacci` result for five numbers between 20 and 40. 每個 `Fibonacci` 結果都會以 `Fibonacci` 類別表示，該類別提供一個執行計算的方法，稱為 `ThreadPoolCallback`。Each `Fibonacci` result is represented by the `Fibonacci` class, which provides a method named `ThreadPoolCallback` that performs the calculation. 這會建立代表每個 `Fibonacci` 值的物件，並將 `ThreadPoolCallback` 方法傳遞至 ，以指派集區中的可用執行緒來執行此方法。An object that represents each `Fibonacci` value is created, and the `ThreadPoolCallback` method is passed to , which assigns an available thread in the pool to execute the method. 因為每個`Fibonacci`物件提供半隨機值來計算，以及每個執行緒會競爭處理器時間，因為您不知道事先花多少時間將會計算所有五個結果。Because each `Fibonacci` object is given a semi-random value to compute, and because each thread will be competing for processor time, you cannot know in advance how long it will take for all five results to be calculated. 這就是為什麼會在建構期間將每個 `Fibonacci` 物件傳遞至 類別的執行個體。That is why each `Fibonacci` object is passed an instance of the class during construction. 每個物件表示提供的事件物件計算完成時，這可讓使用區塊執行主要執行緒直到所有五個`Fibonacci`物件都已計算的結果。Each object signals the provided event object when its calculation is complete, which allows the primary thread to block execution with until all five `Fibonacci` objects have calculated a result. `Main` 方法接著會顯示每個 `Fibonacci` 結果。The `Main` method then displays each `Fibonacci` result. [!code-cpp[System.Threading.ThreadPool QueueUserWorkItem1#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.ThreadPool QueueUserWorkItem1/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Threading.ThreadPool QueueUserWorkItem1#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.ThreadPool QueueUserWorkItem1/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.ThreadPool QueueUserWorkItem1#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.ThreadPool QueueUserWorkItem1/VB/source.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 完畢時使用這個方法傳回時，請呼叫其方法來釋放等候控制代碼的參考。When you are finished using the that is returned by this method, call its method to release references to the wait handle. 我們建議您務必呼叫方法，即使您指定`true`如`executeOnlyOnce`。We recommend that you always call the method, even if you specify `true` for `executeOnlyOnce`. 記憶體回收的運作方式更有效率地如果您呼叫方法，而非根據已註冊之等候控制代碼的完成項。Garbage collection works more efficiently if you call the method instead of depending on the registered wait handle's finalizer. 方法排入佇列的執行緒集區指定的委派。The method queues the specified delegate to the thread pool. 當發生下列其中一項時，背景工作執行緒將執行委派：A worker thread will execute the delegate when one of the following occurs: - 指定的物件處於收到信號的狀態。The specified object is in the signaled state. - 經過逾時間隔。The time-out interval elapses. 方法會檢查指定的物件的目前狀態。The method checks the current state of the specified object's . 如果未發出信號狀態的物件，則方法會註冊等候作業。If the object's state is unsignaled, the method registers a wait operation. 等候作業是由執行緒集區的執行緒執行。The wait operation is performed by a thread from the thread pool. 物件的狀態變成發出訊號，或經過逾時間隔時，背景工作執行緒會執行委派。The delegate is executed by a worker thread when the object's state becomes signaled or the time-out interval elapses. 如果`timeOutInterval`參數不是 0 （零） 和`executeOnlyOnce`參數是`false`，計時器會重設，每次事件收到訊號，或經過逾時間隔。If the `timeOutInterval` parameter is not 0 (zero) and the `executeOnlyOnce` parameter is `false`, the timer is reset every time the event is signaled or the time-out interval elapses. > [!IMPORTANT] > 使用for`waitObject`不提供用於回呼的互斥，因為基礎 Win32 API 會使用預設`WT_EXECUTEDEFAULT`旗標，讓每一個回呼會分派另一個執行緒集區執行緒上。Using a for `waitObject` does not provide mutual exclusion for the callbacks because the underlying Win32 API uses the default `WT_EXECUTEDEFAULT` flag, so each callback is dispatched on a separate thread pool thread. 而不是，使用最大計數為 1。Instead of a , use a with a maximum count of 1. 若要取消之等候作業，呼叫方法。To cancel the wait operation, call the method. 等候執行緒會使用 Win32`WaitForMultipleObjects`函式，以監視已註冊之等候作業。The wait thread uses the Win32 `WaitForMultipleObjects` function to monitor registered wait operations. 因此，如果您必須使用相同的原生作業系統控制代碼，以多次呼叫，您必須重複使用 Win32 控制代碼`DuplicateHandle`函式。Therefore, if you must use the same native operating system handle in multiple calls to , you must duplicate the handle using the Win32 `DuplicateHandle` function. 請注意，您不應該轉盤式事件物件，傳遞至，因為等待執行緒可能會不會偵測事件收到信號之前重設。Note that you should not pulse an event object passed to , because the wait thread might not detect that the event is signaled before it is reset. 在傳回之前，此函式會修改某些類型的同步處理物件的狀態。Before returning, the function modifies the state of some types of synchronization objects. 修改只會發生在其收到信號的狀態造成要滿足等候條件的物件。Modification occurs only for the object whose signaled state caused the wait condition to be satisfied. 比方說，號誌的計數就會減少一個。For example, the count of a semaphore is decreased by one. ## 版本資訊Version Information 從.NET Framework 2.0 版中，開始屬性值會傳播至背景工作執行緒已排入佇列使用方法。Starting with the .NET Framework version 2.0, the property value is propagated to worker threads queued using the method. 在舊版中，主體的資訊不會傳播。In earlier versions, the principal information is not propagated.

我們建議您務必呼叫方法，即使您指定`true`如`executeOnlyOnce`。We recommend that you always call the method, even if you specify `true` for `executeOnlyOnce`. 記憶體回收的運作方式更有效率地如果您呼叫方法，而非根據已註冊之等候控制代碼的完成項。Garbage collection works more efficiently if you call the method instead of depending on the registered wait handle's finalizer. 方法排入佇列的執行緒集區指定的委派。The method queues the specified delegate to the thread pool. 當發生下列其中一項時，背景工作執行緒將執行委派：A worker thread will execute the delegate when one of the following occurs: - 指定的物件處於收到信號的狀態。The specified object is in the signaled state. - 經過逾時間隔。The time-out interval elapses. 方法會檢查指定的物件的目前狀態。The method checks the current state of the specified object's . 如果未發出信號狀態的物件，則方法會註冊等候作業。If the object's state is unsignaled, the method registers a wait operation. 等候作業是由執行緒集區的執行緒執行。The wait operation is performed by a thread from the thread pool. 物件的狀態變成發出訊號，或經過逾時間隔時，背景工作執行緒會執行委派。The delegate is executed by a worker thread when the object's state becomes signaled or the time-out interval elapses. 如果`timeOutInterval`參數不是 0 （零） 和`executeOnlyOnce`參數是`false`，計時器會重設，每次事件收到訊號，或經過逾時間隔。If the `timeOutInterval` parameter is not 0 (zero) and the `executeOnlyOnce` parameter is `false`, the timer is reset every time the event is signaled or the time-out interval elapses. > [!IMPORTANT] > 使用for`waitObject`不提供用於回呼的互斥，因為基礎 Win32 API 會使用預設`WT_EXECUTEDEFAULT`旗標，讓每一個回呼會分派另一個執行緒集區執行緒上。Using a for `waitObject` does not provide mutual exclusion for the callbacks because the underlying Win32 API uses the default `WT_EXECUTEDEFAULT` flag, so each callback is dispatched on a separate thread pool thread. 而不是，使用最大計數為 1。Instead of a , use a with a maximum count of 1. 若要取消之等候作業，呼叫方法。To cancel the wait operation, call the method. 等候執行緒會使用 Win32`WaitForMultipleObjects`函式，以監視已註冊之等候作業。The wait thread uses the Win32 `WaitForMultipleObjects` function to monitor registered wait operations. 因此，如果您必須使用相同的原生作業系統控制代碼，以多次呼叫，您必須重複使用 Win32 控制代碼`DuplicateHandle`函式。Therefore, if you must use the same native operating system handle in multiple calls to , you must duplicate the handle using the Win32 `DuplicateHandle` function. 請注意，您不應該轉盤式事件物件，傳遞至，因為等待執行緒可能會不會偵測事件收到信號之前重設。Note that you should not pulse an event object passed to , because the wait thread might not detect that the event is signaled before it is reset. 在傳回之前，此函式會修改某些類型的同步處理物件的狀態。Before returning, the function modifies the state of some types of synchronization objects. 修改只會發生在其收到信號的狀態造成要滿足等候條件的物件。Modification occurs only for the object whose signaled state caused the wait condition to be satisfied. 比方說，號誌的計數就會減少一個。For example, the count of a semaphore is decreased by one. ## 版本資訊Version Information 從.NET Framework 2.0 版中，開始屬性值會傳播至背景工作執行緒已排入佇列使用方法。Starting with the .NET Framework version 2.0, the property value is propagated to worker threads queued using the method. 在舊版中，主體的資訊不會傳播。In earlier versions, the principal information is not propagated.

is signaled. 在此範例中，是回呼方法`WaitProc`，並等候控制代碼是。In this example, the callback method is `WaitProc`, and the wait handle is an . 此範例會定義`TaskInfo`類別來保存執行時傳遞至回呼的資訊。The example defines a `TaskInfo` class to hold the information that is passed to the callback when it executes. 此範例會建立`TaskInfo`物件，並將其指派一些字串資料。The example creates a `TaskInfo` object and assigns it some string data. 傳回的方法指派給`Handle`欄位`TaskInfo`物件，使回呼方法可以存取。The that is returned by the method is assigned to the `Handle` field of the `TaskInfo` object so that the callback method has access to the . the task will wait for, a delegate that represents the `WaitProc` callback method, a one second time-out interval, and multiple callbacks. 當主執行緒發出信號藉由呼叫其方法，叫用委派。When the main thread signals the by was invoked because the wait handle was signaled, the `WaitProc` method unregisters the , stopping additional callbacks. 在逾時，工作會繼續等候。In the case of a time-out, the task continues to wait. remarks.format: ## Remarks 您無法設定背景工作執行緒或 I/O 完成執行緒的最大數目的數字小於電腦上的處理器數目。You cannot set the maximum number of worker threads or I/O completion threads to a number smaller than the number of processors on the computer. 若要判斷有多少個處理器，擷取的值屬性。To determine how many processors are present, retrieve the value of the property. 此外，您無法設定背景工作執行緒或 I/O 完成執行緒的數字小於對應的最小數目的背景工作執行緒或 I/O 完成執行緒的最大數目。In addition, you cannot set the maximum number of worker threads or I/O completion threads to a number smaller than the corresponding minimum number of worker threads or I/O completion threads. 若要判斷最小執行緒集區大小，請呼叫方法。To determine the minimum thread pool size, call the method. 如果裝載通用語言執行平台，例如藉由 Internet Information Services (IIS) 或 SQL Server 中，主機可以限制或阻止變更執行緒集區大小。If the common language runtime is hosted, for example by Internet Information Services (IIS) or SQL Server, the host can limit or prevent changes to the thread pool size. 變更執行緒集區中的執行緒數目上限時，請務必小心。Use caution when changing the maximum number of threads in the thread pool. 雖然您的程式碼可能會因此而受益，所做的變更可能造成負面影響您使用的程式碼程式庫。While your code might benefit, the changes might have an adverse effect on code libraries you use. 設定執行緒集區大小太大，可能會造成效能問題。Setting the thread pool size too large can cause performance problems. 如果太多的執行緒正在同時執行，工作切換額外負荷會變成重大的因素。If too many threads are executing at the same time, the task switching overhead becomes a significant factor.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 執行緒集區視需要提供新的背景工作執行緒或 I/O 完成執行緒，直到它到達每個類別目錄的最小值。The thread pool provides new worker threads or I/O completion threads on demand until it reaches the minimum for each category. 當到達最小值時，執行緒集區可以建立額外的執行緒，該類別中，或等到部分工作完成。When the minimum is reached, the thread pool can create additional threads in that category or wait until some tasks complete. 開頭為[!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]，執行緒集區建立和終結執行緒，以便最佳化輸送量，而定義為每個時間單位完成的工作數目。Beginning with the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)], the thread pool creates and destroys threads in order to optimize throughput, which is defined as the number of tasks that complete per unit of time. 執行緒太少可能無法最有效地利用可用資源，而執行緒太多則可能增加資源爭用的情況。Too few threads might not make optimal use of available resources, whereas too many threads could increase resource contention. 當需求很低時，執行緒集區執行緒的實際數目可能低於最小值。When demand is low, the actual number of thread pool threads can fall below the minimum values. 如果您指定為負數或大於的使用中執行緒集區執行緒的數目上限的數字 (使用取得)，傳回`false`並不會變更其中一個最小值。If you specify a negative number or a number larger than the maximum number of active thread pool threads (obtained using ), returns `false` and does not change either of the minimum values. > [!CAUTION] > 根據預設，執行緒的數目下限設為在系統上的處理器數目。By default, the minimum number of threads is set to the number of processors on a system. 您可以使用方法，以增加最低的數字 ofthreads。You can use the method to increase the minimum number ofthreads. 不過，不必要地增加這些值，可能會造成效能問題。However, unnecessarily increasing these values can cause performance problems. 如果太多工作同時啟動，則所有工作可能都會變慢。If too many tasks start at the same time, all of them might appear to be slow. 在大部分情況下，執行緒集區會比較好使用它自己的演算法來配置執行緒。In most cases, the thread pool will perform better with its own algorithm for allocating threads. 減少到小於處理器數目也會降低效能的最小值。Reducing the minimum to less than the number of processors can also hurt performance. ## Examples 下列範例會設定背景工作執行緒的數目下限為 4，並保留原始值的非同步 I/O 完成執行緒的數目下限。The following example sets the minimum number of worker threads to four, and preserves the original value for the minimum number of asynchronous I/O completion threads. [!code-cpp[System.Threading.ThreadPool.GetSetMinThreads#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.ThreadPool.GetSetMinThreads/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Threading.ThreadPool.GetSetMinThreads#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.ThreadPool.GetSetMinThreads/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.ThreadPool.GetSetMinThreads#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.ThreadPool.GetSetMinThreads/VB/source.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如需有關使用原生 Win32 資訊重疊的 I/O，請參閱 < 類別，結構，而`OVERLAPPED`Win32 平台 SDK 中的結構。For information about using native Win32 overlapped I/O, see the class, the structure, and the `OVERLAPPED` structure in the Win32 Platform SDK. > [!CAUTION] > 使用方法可能會不慎開啟造成安全性漏洞。Using the method could inadvertently open up a security hole. 程式碼存取安全性基底的使用權限檢查堆疊上的所有呼叫端的權限。Code access security bases its permission checks on the permissions of all the callers on the stack. 工作執行緒集區執行緒使用的佇列時，執行緒集區執行緒的堆疊並沒有實際的呼叫端的內容。When work is queued on a thread pool thread using , the stack of the thread pool thread does not have the context of the actual callers. 惡意程式碼可能可以利用此選項可避免權限檢查。Malicious code might be able exploit this to avoid permission checks.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 不同於方法，不會傳播至背景工作執行緒的呼叫堆疊。Unlike the method, does not propagate the calling stack to the worker thread. 這可讓程式碼會遺失呼叫堆疊，因此提高其安全性特殊權限。This allows code to lose the calling stack and thereby to elevate its security privileges. > [!CAUTION] > 使用造成安全性漏洞可能會不慎開啟。Using could inadvertently open up a security hole. 程式碼存取安全性基底的使用權限檢查堆疊上的所有呼叫端的權限。Code access security bases its permission checks on the permissions of all the callers on the stack. 工作執行緒集區執行緒使用的佇列時，執行緒集區執行緒的堆疊不會有實際的呼叫端的內容。When work is queued on a thread pool thread using , the stack of the thread pool thread will not have the context of the actual callers. 惡意程式碼可能可以利用此選項可避免權限檢查。Malicious code might be able exploit this to avoid permission checks.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 不同於方法，不會傳播至背景工作執行緒的呼叫堆疊。Unlike the method, does not propagate the calling stack to the worker thread. 這可讓程式碼會遺失呼叫堆疊，因此提高其安全性特殊權限。This allows code to lose the calling stack and thereby to elevate its security privileges. > [!CAUTION] > 使用造成安全性漏洞可能會不慎開啟。Using could inadvertently open up a security hole. 程式碼存取安全性基底的使用權限檢查堆疊上的所有呼叫端的權限。Code access security bases its permission checks on the permissions of all the callers on the stack. 工作執行緒集區執行緒使用的佇列時，執行緒集區執行緒的堆疊不會有實際的呼叫端的內容。When work is queued on a thread pool thread using , the stack of the thread pool thread will not have the context of the actual callers. 惡意程式碼可能可以利用此選項可避免權限檢查。Malicious code might be able exploit this to avoid permission checks. 使用for`waitObject`不提供用於回呼的互斥，因為基礎 Win32 API 會使用預設`WT_EXECUTEDEFAULT`旗標，讓每一個回呼會分派另一個執行緒集區執行緒上。Using a for `waitObject` does not provide mutual exclusion for the callbacks because the underlying Win32 API uses the default `WT_EXECUTEDEFAULT` flag, so each callback is dispatched on a separate thread pool thread. 完畢時使用這個方法傳回時，請呼叫其方法來釋放等候控制代碼的參考。When you are finished using the that is returned by this method, call its method to release references to the wait handle. 我們建議您務必呼叫方法，即使您指定`true`如`executeOnlyOnce`。We recommend that you always call the method, even if you specify `true` for `executeOnlyOnce`. 記憶體回收的運作方式更有效率地如果您呼叫方法，而非根據已註冊之等候控制代碼的完成項。Garbage collection works more efficiently if you call the method instead of depending on the registered wait handle's finalizer.
